intro: Hieracium panaeolum, commonly known as the Italian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, pastures, and along roadsides. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium panaeolum is often considered a weed but has historical uses in traditional medicine.
